en: Office of the President of the Republic of China

location.zh-cn: 中华民国 台北市中正区重庆南路一段122号
location.en: No. 122, Section 1, Chongqing South Road, Zhongzheng District, Taipei City, Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国总统的幕僚机关，负责处理与总统、副总统有关的行政事务。其直接前身为国民政府。
description.en: The staff agency for the President of the Republic of China, responsible for handling administrative affairs related to the President and Vice President. Its direct predecessor was the Nationalist Government.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国在1925年至1948年间的最高权力机关，后改制为总统府。
description.en: The highest governing body of the Republic of China from 1925 to 1948, later reorganized into the Office of the President.

en: President of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的国家元首职位。
description.en: The position of the head of state of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国家级学术研究机构，隶属于总统府。
description.en: The national academy of the Republic of China, affiliated with the Office of the President.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国负责纂修国史的政府机构，隶属于总统府。
description.en: The government agency of the Republic of China responsible for compiling national history, affiliated with the Office of the President.

description.zh-cn: 台湾政治人物，现任中华民国总统府秘书长。
description.en: Taiwanese politician, current Secretary-General of the Office of the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 台湾政治人物，现任中华民国总统府特任副秘书长。
description.en: Taiwanese politician, current Specially Appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the Office of the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 现任中华民国总统府简任副秘书长。
description.en: Current Merit-Appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the Office of the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，1948年行宪后担任首任总统。
description.en: Chinese politician and military leader who served as the first president of the Republic of China after the implementation of the constitution in 1948.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，1948年行宪后担任首任副总统。
description.en: Chinese warlord and politician who served as the first vice president of the Republic of China after the implementation of the constitution in 1948.

en: Vice President of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的备位元首职位。
description.en: The deputy head of state position of the Republic of China.

nodes.id: 光复大陆设计研究委员会

zh-cn: 光复大陆设计研究委员会
en: Planning Commission for the Recovery of Mainland China

description.zh-cn: 曾为中华民国总统府直属机构，负责光复大陆地区后各项重建准备工作之研究与设计。
description.en: A former agency directly under the Office of the President of the Republic of China, responsible for research and planning for reconstruction after the recovery of mainland China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，曾任中华民国总统。
description.en: Taiwanese politician who served as President of the Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中华民国总统府发言人

zh-cn: 中华民国总统府发言人
en: Spokesperson for the Office of the President of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 代表中华民国总统府对外发言的职位，由马英九总统任内增设。
description.en: The position responsible for speaking on behalf of the Office of the President of the Republic of China, established during the presidency of Ma Ying-jeou.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，现任中华民国总统。
description.en: Taiwanese politician, current President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 位于台北市的建筑，现为中华民国总统府的办公厅舍。原为台湾日治时期的台湾总督府。
description.en: A building located in Taipei City, currently serving as the office of the Office of the President of the Republic of China. It was originally the Office of the Governor-General of Taiwan during the Japanese rule period.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的最高行政机关。
description.en: The highest administrative organ of the Republic of China.

en: Office of the Governor-General of Taiwan

description.zh-cn: 台湾日治时期的最高统治机关，其办公厅舍后来成为中华民国总统府。
description.en: The highest ruling body during the period of Japanese rule in Taiwan. Its office building later became the Presidential Office Building of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 指陈水扁担任中华民国总统期间的政府。
description.en: Refers to the government of the Republic of China during Chen Shui-bian's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 指赖清德担任中华民国总统期间的政府。
description.en: Refers to the government of the Republic of China during Lai Ching-te's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国总统府曾存在的任务编组，为总统的国家统一问题咨询机构。
description.en: A former task force of the Office of the President of the Republic of China, which served as an advisory body to the President on issues of national unification.

nodes.id: 总统府人权咨询委员会

zh-cn: 总统府人权咨询委员会
en: Presidential Office Human Rights Consultative Committee

description.zh-cn: 中华民国总统府曾存在的任务编组，为总统的人权政策咨询机构。
description.en: A former task force of the Office of the President of the Republic of China, which served as an advisory body to the President on human rights policy.

nodes.id: 总统府国家气候变迁对策委员会

zh-cn: 总统府国家气候变迁对策委员会
国家气候变迁对策委员会

description.zh-cn: 由总统赖清德宣布成立并亲自领军的总统府任务编组之一，旨在应对气候变迁问题。
description.en: One of the Presidential Office task forces announced and personally led by President Lai Ching-te, aimed at addressing climate change issues.

nodes.id: 总统府健康台湾推动委员会

zh-cn: 总统府健康台湾推动委员会

description.zh-cn: 由总统赖清德宣布成立并亲自领军的总统府任务编组之一，旨在推动国民健康。
description.en: One of the Presidential Office task forces announced and personally led by President Lai Ching-te, aimed at promoting national health.

nodes.id: 总统府全社会防卫韧性委员会

zh-cn: 总统府全社会防卫韧性委员会
全社会防卫韧性委员会

description.zh-cn: 由总统赖清德宣布成立并亲自领军的总统府任务编组之一，旨在强化社会整体防卫能力。
description.en: One of the Presidential Office task forces announced and personally led by President Lai Ching-te, aimed at strengthening all-out defense capabilities.

description.zh-cn: 1948年5月20日，原为中华民国最高权力机关的国民政府改制为总统府，成为总统的幕僚机构。
description.en: On May 20, 1948, the Nationalist Government, originally the highest organ of power in the Republic of China, was reorganized into the Office of the President, becoming the president's staff agency.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国总统府是中华民国总统的幕僚机关。
description.en: The Office of the President is the staff agency for the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中央研究院是中华民国总统府的附属机关。
description.en: Academia Sinica is an affiliated institution of the Office of the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 国史馆是中华民国总统府的附属机关。
description.en: Academia Historica is an affiliated institution of the Office of the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 潘孟安为现任中华民国总统府秘书长。
description.en: Pan Men-an is the current Secretary-General of the Office of the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 何志伟为现任中华民国总统府特任副秘书长。
description.en: Ho Chih-wei is the current Specially Appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the Office of the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 郑俊升为现任中华民国总统府简任副秘书长。
description.en: Cheng Chun-sheng is the current Merit-Appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the Office of the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 1948年5月20日，蒋中正就任中华民国行宪后首任总统。
description.en: On May 20, 1948, Chiang Kai-shek was inaugurated as the first President of the Republic of China after the implementation of the Constitution.

description.zh-cn: 1948年5月20日，李宗仁就任中华民国行宪后首任副总统。
description.en: On May 20, 1948, Li Zongren was inaugurated as the first Vice President of the Republic of China after the implementation of the Constitution.

relationships.target: 光复大陆设计研究委员会

description.zh-cn: 时任总统蒋中正依照《动员戡乱时期临时条款》授权以总统令公布《光复大陆设计研究委员会组织纲要》，将行政院设计委员会改为总统府直属单位。
description.en: Then-President Chiang Kai-shek, authorized by the 'Temporary Provisions Effective During the Period of Communist Rebellion', promulgated the 'Organizational Outline of the Planning Commission for the Recovery of Mainland China' by presidential decree, changing the Executive Yuan's planning committee into a unit directly under the Office of the President.

relationships.target: 中华民国总统府发言人

description.zh-cn: 时任总统马英九决定增设总统府发言人职位。
description.en: Then-President Ma Ying-jeou decided to establish the position of Presidential Office Spokesperson.

relationships.target: 总统府国家气候变迁对策委员会

description.zh-cn: 总统赖清德于就职满月时宣布成立三个委员会，并亲自领军，国家气候变迁对策委员会为其中之一。
description.en: President Lai Ching-te announced the establishment of three committees on the first month anniversary of his inauguration, which he would personally lead. The National Climate Change Response Committee is one of them.

relationships.target: 总统府健康台湾推动委员会

description.zh-cn: 总统赖清德于就职满月时宣布成立三个委员会，并亲自领军，健康台湾推动委员会为其中之一。
description.en: President Lai Ching-te announced the establishment of three committees on the first month anniversary of his inauguration, which he would personally lead. The Healthy Taiwan Promotion Committee is one of them.

relationships.target: 总统府全社会防卫韧性委员会

description.zh-cn: 总统赖清德于就职满月时宣布成立三个委员会，并亲自领军，全社会防卫韧性委员会为其中之一。
description.en: President Lai Ching-te announced the establishment of three committees on the first month anniversary of his inauguration, which he would personally lead. The All-Out Defense Resilience Committee is one of them.

description.zh-cn: 总统府厅舍在台湾日治时期为台湾总督府的办公厅舍。
description.en: The Presidential Office Building served as the office of the Governor-General of Taiwan during the period of Japanese rule.

description.zh-cn: 自1949年12月9日起，中华民国总统府设址于此办公。
description.en: Since December 9, 1949, the Office of the President of the Republic of China has been located in this building.

description.zh-cn: 在1949年至1957年间，行政院与总统府共同使用此建筑合署办公。
description.en: Between 1949 and 1957, the Executive Yuan and the Office of the President shared this building for joint office work.

description.zh-cn: 陈水扁政府时期，将总统府厅舍门首的“介寿馆”衔牌取下，更换为“总统府”衔牌。
description.en: During the Chen Shui-bian administration, the 'Jieshou Hall' plaque on the front of the Presidential Office Building was removed and replaced with a 'Presidential Office' plaque.

description.zh-cn: 赖清德政府时期启用了新的中华民国总统府识别标志。
description.en: A new identification logo for the Office of the President of the Republic of China was enabled during the Lai Ching-te administration.

description.zh-cn: 总统府依《国家统一委员会设置要点》成立国家统一委员会。
description.en: The Presidential Office established the National Unification Council in accordance with the 'Essentials for the Establishment of the National Unification Council'.

relationships.target: 总统府人权咨询委员会

description.zh-cn: 总统府于2000年成立人权咨询小组，并于2004年扩编为总统府人权咨询委员会。
description.en: The Presidential Office established a human rights advisory group in 2000, which was expanded into the Presidential Office Human Rights Consultative Committee in 2004.
